image.altText: A tree with its branches down on the ground at Henley Beach

props.synopsis: Destructive winds sweeping across South Australia have damaged roofs, fences and caused power outages, with the BOM recording two "likely" tornadoes in Adelaide's northern suburbs.

title.children: Two small and fast-moving tornadoes 'likely' hit Adelaide's northern suburbs

image.altText: a young woman leans against a wall staring at the camera with a somber expression

props.synopsis: From poorly categorised NDIS support to high rates of suicide, Tourette syndrome advocates say it's the last disability where "it's still acceptable for people to laugh at".

title.children: 'Loudest in the room ... yet still invisible': Tourette syndrome advocates plead for change

image.altText: A black and white photo of a man diving from a height in front of people watching and boathouses on a river

props.synopsis: The small Victorian town of Nelson has endured tough times over the past five years, but now a small group of friends plans to revive an event that attracted huge crowds up until the 1970s.

title.children: Can this historic regatta coax tourists back to struggling river town?

image.altText: An aerial image of sheep and a tractor in a dusty paddock.

props.synopsis: The federal government announces an additional $1 billion for farm drought loans and commits to continuing the scheme beyond 2026.

title.children: Drought assistance extended with $1b for Victorian, SA farmers

image.altText: Matthew Draganoff in front of a Union Jack flag

props.synopsis: The brother of a man murdered by his landlord in 2021 has told the man responsible he had taken "the heart and soul of a family" and could not "unsee" the harrowing footage of the victim's final moments.

title.children: 'How could you possibly do this to our family?' Impact statements read to landlord who murdered man

image.altText: Three men and two women sitting at a long white desk

props.synopsis: Two energy companies that were set to benefit from a more than $5 billion desalination plant and water pipeline have pulled out, prompting questions over the project's final cost and feasibility.

title.children: Private backers exit from SA’s $5 billion Northern Water project

image.altText: A man in a suit walks out of a court building with glass doors

props.synopsis: Political experts, politicians and the public say a by-election should be held in the state seat of Mount Gambier ahead of the South Australian state election in seven months to make sure the city is represented in parliament.

title.children: Guilty South Australian MP's exit set to spark by-election

image.altText: A white woman wearing a white top and blue jeans raises her hands and sings on stage

props.synopsis: A remote kids choir and a large outback music festival are keen to continue their partnership after successful performances in far west New South Wales.

title.children: Outback children's choir thrives under festival 'special' partnership

image.altText: A diver holding a tape measure next to a rocky structure in a lake

props.synopsis: One of Australia's best-known divers, Richard Harris, was among those given a rare glimpse below Mount Gambier's major water source and tourist attraction.

title.children: Divers given rare chance to plunge below surface of mysterious lake

image.altText: A stone building with large columns

props.synopsis: A disability carer who killed her client in a crash south of Adelaide when she "lost control" and mistakenly hit the accelerator instead of a brake has been spared an immediate jail term.

title.children: Disability carer sentenced for killing client in 'terrible accident'

image.altText: Dead globefish covered in sand on beach.

props.synopsis: Scientific efforts are getting microscopic on the biggest algal bloom in Australia’s history to see if it hides secrets that could stop its spread.

title.children: 'Frighteningly complex': Scientists race to find solution to algal crisis

image.altText: A man sits on a couch, looking to the side with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Seven years ago Richard Boyle's home was raided after he spoke out about heavy-handed debt collection tactics at the Australian Taxation Office. Now the whistleblower's case has finally closed, as he walks from court with a one-year good behaviour bond.

title.children: ATO whistleblower's 'suffered' for years since AFP raids

image.altText: Four Giant Australian cuttlefish are seen close up at a low angle under water. they are purple and grey in colour.

props.synopsis: A highly experimental, nearly $700,000 "bubble curtain" will be installed next week hoping to protect cuttlefish and their eggs in the Upper Spencer Gulf from South Australia's toxic algal bloom.

title.children: 'Bubble curtain' to protect giant Australian cuttlefish from algal bloom

image.altText: A screenshot of a woman inside a clinic with a graphic behind her 'Building a bigger health system'

props.synopsis: South Australians are seeing more advertising on their screens promoting the state government's infrastructure projects and health spending, prompting questions over the line between political and government advertising.

title.children: SA government accused of 'spruiking' its agenda in taxpayer-funded ads

image.altText: A woman and man hold each other surrounded by a crowd.

props.synopsis: Australian Taxation Office whistleblower Richard Boyle has avoided convictions and a jail sentence, seven years after publicly exposing aggressive debt collection practices at the tax office.

title.children: ATO whistleblower Richard Boyle spared convictions, jail sentence

image.altText: A group of people in orange uniforms cheering around a small flat vehicle with solar panels on top

props.synopsis: Dutch team Brunel has been crowned the winners of the 2025 World Solar Challenge after a five-day marathon race across the Australian outback.

title.children: Dutch team 'back from the ashes' of 2019 fire to win World Solar Challenge

image.altText: APY Lands general manager Richard King.

props.synopsis: The South Australian government says it will appoint administrators to run the remote APY Lands in the state's Far North amid concerns over governance.

title.children: SA government to appoint administrators to run APY Lands

image.altText: Close-up of a man with a bruised and puffy face with tubes in his nose

props.synopsis: Many AFL players look forward to going back to playing the sport for fun after they leave the professional league. But it's not always a warm welcome back into the lower leagues. The ABC speaks to former stars and their families about the brutal transition out of the game.

title.children: 'I can't stand you': Ex-AFL players targeted in lower leagues

image.altText: A woman smiling to camera.

props.synopsis: The upcoming March for Australia has drawn mixed reactions among migrants, with some fearful of anti-immigration sentiment, while others say they are not concerned.

title.children: Nationwide March for Australia sparks mixed reactions among migrants

image.altText: A woman in a hijab sits in front of a press vest

props.synopsis: Israel has killed 240 Palestinian journalists, according to a local union. Those still standing say "no one is safe".

title.children: Nour is one of Gaza's surviving journalists. She feels like she's in a 'queue to death'

image.altText: A man stoops to lay a shotgun on a pile of other guns

props.synopsis: As police hunt a suspected gunman through rugged terrain in the Victoria's High Country, there are more than 4 million registered weapons across the country.

title.children: Australia has more guns now than before the Port Arthur massacre

image.altText: Former Vice President Kamala Harris

props.synopsis: The president's former rival is due to go on tour to promote her book on her failed campaign called 107 Days.

title.children: Donald Trump cancels Kamala Harris's Secret Service protection

image.altText: Julia Roberts stands in front of a backdrop for the Venice Film Festival

props.synopsis: The Hollywood actress waved off concerns that her new film casts suspicion on women who come forward with sexual misconduct allegations, saying it's aimed at creating conversation.

title.children: Julia Roberts defends #MeToo criticism of film at Venice

image.altText: A female with dark hair smiles and waves at the camera

props.synopsis: Thailand's Constitutional Court sacks Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra for ethics violation.

title.children: Thai court sacks PM Paetongtarn Shinawatra

image.altText: A boy looks at his phone showing a Tiktok account

props.synopsis: Egyptian police arrest of dozens of teenage TikTokkers, accusing them of crimes ranging from indecency to money laundering.

title.children: Egyptian police arrest dozens of teenage TikTokkers in social media crackdown

image.altText: A crowded beach in Eurpoe, with many people and umbrellas on the sand.

props.synopsis: How can we keep exploring without leaving such a heavy footprint? And where should we go if we want to travel green?

title.children: Want to see the world? Here's how to leave a smaller footprint

image.altText: A man in a black puffer jacket leaves court while pretending to be on a phone call

props.synopsis: A Melbourne lawyer ripped off his victim to the tune of $482,000 with a scheme that included grandiose promises, fake court cases and fabricated legal documents.

title.children: 'Pitiful' Melbourne lawyer caught stealing from grieving widow

image.altText: Craig Bellamy, head coach of the Storm, angry as he walks onto a field after a match

props.synopsis: Rugby recruit Mark Nawaqanitawase bags four tries as the Sydney Roosters scored 40 unanswered points to down Melbourne in Craig Bellamy's milestone match.

title.children: Roosters storm home, leave their Mark as Bellamy fumes over 'embarrassing' Storm loss

image.altText: A man in a tie leaves the courthouse as journalists and cameramen gather around.

props.synopsis: After a month-long criminal trial, celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright faces possible prison time after being found guilty on two charges of attempting to pervert the course of justice.

title.children: 'Truth about the cover-up': Matt Wright stares down prison after verdict

image.altText: Runners cross the Sydney Harbour Bridge as part of the Sydney Marathon 2024

props.synopsis: Police officers will be out in full force in Sydney's CBD as 35,000 runners are expected at the Sydney Marathon, and thousands of protesters at three separate rallies.

title.children: Marathon and three protests: Sydneysiders warned of major disruptions on Sunday

image.altText: A man at a press conference

props.synopsis: The state's emergency management commissioner warns Victorians to "prepare now" as dangerous winds exceeding 100 kilometres per hour approach.

title.children: Power outages expected as dangerous winds batter Victoria

image.altText: Giorgia Meloni speaking into two microphones.

props.synopsis: The website was taken down after widespread condemnation and legal complaints.

title.children: Italy's Giorgia Meloni 'disgusted' with adult website using her image

image.altText: Tanya Plibersek sits in parliament wearing a light blue suit with short blonde hair.

props.synopsis: The federal court finds that the federal government failed traditional owners when the former water minister approved a water resource plan she had not read.

title.children: Tanya Plibersek approved water plan without reading it, court finds

image.altText: A composite image of nine book covers on background fading from purple to orange

props.synopsis: In this month's best new releases, humans transform into trees, grief meets the supernatural in a haunted house and a volcanic eruption disrupts life in rural New Zealand.

title.children: The nine books our critics couldn't put down in August
